retrospectives.summary: 9 mistakes analyzed. 4 protocol violations (M336, M337, M339, M341), 2 assumption errors (M340, M344), 1 output formatting (M338), 1 environment corruption (M342), 1 prompt engineering (M343). PATTERN-008 (pre-rendered bypass) continues with 4 new occurrences despite ESCALATE-A008. New patterns: M342 worktree cwd corruption (hook added), M344 subagent tool confusion (concept doc updated).

findings.notes: PATTERN-008 now has 10 total occurrences. ESCALATE-A008 implemented FAIL-FAST but pattern persists. M339 shows PATTERN-005 (delegation bypass) still occurring. M344 introduced explicit tool access documentation in subagent-delegation.md.

retrospectives.summary: 24 mistakes analyzed across 14 categories. Dominant: protocol_violation (8), assumption_without_verification (2), prompt_engineering (2), rca_failure (2). PATTERN-001 (subagent validation fabrication) continues with 3 new occurrences (M346, M349, M356). Three new patterns identified: PATTERN-010 (two-run validation bypass), PATTERN-011 (RCA symptom fix), PATTERN-012 (subagent prompt priming). Action items A004, A006, A007 remain effective. A001, A002, A005, A008 partially effective.

findings.notes: PATTERN-001 now has 9 total occurrences, 5 after A001 fix - needs escalation. New patterns around compare-docs two-run bypass (PATTERN-010), RCA source-vs-symptom confusion (PATTERN-011), and subagent prompt priming (PATTERN-012). All three addressed via skill documentation updates already implemented during mistake recordings.

retrospectives.summary: 8 mistakes across 8 categories. New pattern identified: delegation_tooling_confusion (PATTERN-013). One new action item (A013) for delegation guidance. Existing action items A004, A006, A007 confirmed effective.

22 mistakes analyzed. Dominant category: protocol_violation (6). A008 (pre-rendered output) continues to have violations despite escalation - requires further investigation. New action A014 created for hook coverage gaps (M398).

patterns_identified.PATTERN-008: continues despite escalation - 2 new violations (M389, M395)

retrospectives.summary: 13 mistakes analyzed (M401-M413). Root cause discovery: PATTERN-008 (verbatim output failures) traced to Claude Code bug #16538 - plugin SessionStart hooks don't surface additionalContext for new sessions. Fix implemented via UserPromptSubmit handler workaround in session_instructions.py.

findings.root_cause_chain: M401→M402→M403→M407→M410→M411→M412→M413 traced to Claude Code bug #16538

system_bug_discovered.description: Plugin SessionStart hooks execute but additionalContext is silently discarded for new sessions
system_bug_discovered.workaround: UserPromptSubmit handler injects session instructions on first user prompt

findings.notes: PATTERN-008 verbatim output failures were not documentation/skill issues - the session instructions were never being delivered due to Claude Code bug. Workaround implemented.

retrospectives.summary: Batch skill invocation failures during compress-skills-batch-5 task. Chain of 5 related failures: subagent confusion → failure message priming → skill bypass → manual implementation.

new_patterns.description: Chain failures when batch operations require nested skill invocations. Subagents fail/fabricate, failure messages prime bypass, main agent does work manually.

new_action_items.description: Failure messages must include actionable recovery guidance: retry with single file, escalate to user, NEVER bypass skill. Implemented in M429 prevention.
Remove detailed failure response examples from skill docs to prevent fabrication (M428 pattern). Skills should document success format only.

retrospectives.summary: Wide category spread (9 categories, 10 mistakes). No dominant failure mode. 7/10 preventions at skill level (weakest). No recurrences. No new patterns with 2+ occurrences. Previous fixes holding.

observations: Wide category spread - no dominant failure mode
7/10 preventions at skill level - weakest tier
No recurrences - previous pattern fixes holding
M438 prevention not yet implemented (issue created)

retrospectives.summary: 10 mistakes across 7 categories. No dominant failure mode. PATTERN-008 (pre-rendered bypass) recurs again (M452). Two new patterns: PATTERN-015 (shell operator escaping, 2 occurrences) and PATTERN-016 (squash commit corruption, 2 occurrences). Three new action items: A017 (enforce Python for comparisons), A018 (rebase-before-squash), A019 (banner script re-invocation fallback).

findings.notes: Wide category spread confirms pattern fixes are holding (no dominant cluster). Shell escaping (PATTERN-015) recurs despite M431 skill-level prevention. Squash workflow (PATTERN-016) is new vulnerability. Hook false positive (M447) shows hook aggressiveness reaching diminishing returns.

retrospectives.summary: Protocol violations dominant (4/9). M456 recurs M252 (worktree bypass). New finding: M460 speculation-as-fact pattern. Handler bug: run_retrospective_handler.py timezone comparison crash.

10 mistakes (M464-M476, skipping some IDs). Protocol violations dominant (4/10). Shell corruption recurrence (M464→M474) despite M392 fix - hook lacked execute permissions. Subagent fabrication recurrence (M470 recurs M423) in learn skill. No new patterns meeting 2+ threshold in this period alone, but protocol_violation category shows persistent issues.

retrospectives.summary: 26 mistakes across 14 categories. Protocol violations dominant (12/26, 46%). Three key clusters: (1) squash workflow failures (PATTERN-016, 4 new: M484/M488/M500/M503) - A018 ineffective, M503 added hook enforcement; (2) approval gate bypass (new PATTERN-017, 3: M479/M480/M489) - already addressed by hook+protocol; (3) stakeholder review quality (new PATTERN-018, 4: M478/M496/M498/M499) - reviewers miss cross-file issues. A001/A003 confirmed ineffective. A004/A006/A007 remain effective.

observations: Protocol violations remain dominant category (12/26, 46%)
Squash workflow (PATTERN-016) expanded from 2 to 6 occurrences - A018 ineffective, but M503 hook now blocks git reset --soft
New approval gate pattern (PATTERN-017) with 3 rapid recurrences - addressed by hook + protocol doc
New stakeholder review quality pattern (PATTERN-018) - reviewers miss cross-file duplication and validation gaps
6 recurrences detected - worktree corruption (M491/M493 recur M464) persists despite fixes
A004/A006/A007 remain consistently effective across all retrospective periods

retrospectives.summary: First consolidated retrospective. 106 mistakes across 25 categories. protocol_violation dominates (50%). 9 patterns identified, 9 action items tracked. 3 implemented with no recurrence. 6 open. Index.json data integrity fixed.

new_patterns.note: Stakeholder review skill has workflow gaps: agent skips re-run after fixes, diff range misses multi-commit worktrees. Both preventions implemented.
Merge/cleanup phase misses edge cases: CWD inside worktree during removal, orphaned backup branches not cleaned. M347 hook implemented; M348 code fix pending.

new_action_items.description: Add backup-before-squash-* branch cleanup to merge-and-cleanup.sh after successful merge

patterns_updated.note: A004 superseded by A008 (same problem, broader scope). Recommend closing A004.

observations: protocol_violation dominates at 50% of all mistakes - most have skill-level preventions which are inherently fragile
3 implemented action items (A001, A002, A015) have no post-fix recurrences - hook-level prevention is effective
6 open action items remain, 2 high priority (A008) and 4 medium priority
A004 and A008 overlap - A004 should be closed as superseded
Index.json was missing file references and consolidated data - fixed during this retrospective

retrospectives.summary: 9 mistakes across 5 categories. Protocol violations (3/9) remain most common. PATTERN-008 (verbatim output) continues with 2 new failures (M354, M355) in status skill. A018 (squash workflow) ineffective with 4 post-fix failures - escalated. New A021 for PATTERN-018 (stakeholder review quality). M361 identified false positive in empirical-test methodology.

escalations_created.reason: Squash workflow continues to fail despite A018. 4 post-fix mistakes (M484, M488, M500, M503). M503 added RemindGitSquash hook blocking git reset --soft, but underlying issue is worktree staleness and manual squash bypass.

observations: Protocol violations remain most common (3/9)
PATTERN-008 (verbatim output) persists despite multiple preventions - verbatim failures in status skill output
A018 escalated after 4 post-fix failures - partial fix (hook) in place but gap remains
PATTERN-018 (stakeholder review quality) has no action items until now - A021 created to address file-reading gaps
M361 false positive: empirical-test methodology creates expected failures that shouldn't be logged as retrospective mistakes
Category spread wider (5 categories) - no dominant failure mode in this period

retrospectives.summary: 14 mistakes across 8 categories. Protocol violations dominant (5/14, 36%). Three key clusters: (1) stakeholder review quality (PATTERN-018, 3 new: M364/M368/M370) - reviewers use wrong workspace paths and lack domain knowledge; (2) squash workflow (PATTERN-016, 2 new: M362/M369) - unsquashed commits at gate, worktree diverged after squash; (3) verbatim output (PATTERN-008, 2 new: M353/M354/M355) - status skill instruction ordering and framing failures. New action item A022 for learn skill commit-grouping protocol. Escalations updated: A001 continues ineffective (subagent fabrication persists), A018 continues with hook partially addressing squash bypass.

escalations_updated.update: A001 remains ineffective. PATTERN-018 (stakeholder review) recurring with 3 new mistakes (M364/M368/M370). Subagent fabrication and wrong-path reads persist despite documentation and hook-level preventions. Root cause is subagents ignoring delegation prompts and using default CWD. A021 and A022 address downstream symptoms; core subagent compliance gap unresolved.

A018 remains ineffective for squash workflow. 2 new failures (M362: unsquashed commits presented at gate, M369: worktree diverged after squash with backup_verified:true). RemindGitSquash hook blocks git reset --soft but does not enforce pre-gate squash verification. Gap: no gate check that COMMIT_COUNT == 1 before Step 7. M362 prevention adds commit count verification to work-with-issue skill.

recurrences.M354: M353 (status skill verbatim - skipped box content)
recurrences.M368: M364 (stakeholder reviewer prompt simplification causing wrong workspace reads)

observations: Protocol violations remain most common category (5/14, 36%)
PATTERN-018 (stakeholder review quality) has 3 new occurrences - A021 now open, implementation needed
PATTERN-016 (squash commit corruption) continues: M362 (pre-gate squash skip) and M369 (worktree diverged after squash)
PATTERN-008 (verbatim output) has 3 new status-skill failures (M353/M354/M355) - skill instruction ordering is root cause
M365 (--no-ff documentation priming) is a new misleading_documentation instance related to PATTERN-012
M371 (convention_violation - records without compact constructors) is isolated; convention doc fix implemented
A001/A003/A018 all confirmed ineffective across multiple retrospectives - structural enforcement needed
A004/A006/A007 remain consistently effective - hook-level preventions outperform documentation-level

observations: Protocol violations remain dominant category (7/12, 58%)
PATTERN-016 (squash_commit_corruption) now 11 total occurrences - three distinct sub-issues with code-level fixes pending

retrospectives.summary: 14 mistakes analyzed. Dominant: protocol_violation (9), assumption_without_verification (2), misleading_documentation (2), tool_misuse (1). Three action items remain ineffective: A001, A003, A018. All require structural code-level fixes. PATTERN-016 (squash corruption) has highest after-fix recurrence rate (9/11). Open items A021, A023, A024 unimplemented.

ESCALATE-A001.why_ineffective: Documentation-level prevention does not structurally prevent subagents combining producer/validator roles. Prompt priming causes subagents to skip actual tool invocations. PATTERN-001 at 9 total/5 after-fix - rate reduced but pattern not eliminated.
ESCALATE-A001.stronger_fix: Implement PostToolUse hook scanning subagent Task output for validation claims, cross-referencing session transcript for cat:compare-docs or cat:stakeholder-review invocation evidence. If score reported without tool evidence, emit blocking error forcing re-delegation.

ESCALATE-A003.why_ineffective: Hook covers Edit/Write tool calls only. Path assumption failures occur in commit routing decisions, learn skill subagent navigation, and shell commands. PATTERN-003 at 3 total/4 after-fix - occurrences increased after fix.
ESCALATE-A003.stronger_fix: Expand hook to intercept Bash tool calls with absolute /workspace/ paths when active worktree exists. Add explicit path confirmation step to all skills performing git commits (learn, work-merge, git-commit).

ESCALATE-A018.why_ineffective: Three code-level sub-fixes identified but not implemented: (1) GitSquash.java backup branch cleanup, (2) work-with-issue pre-gate commit count check, (3) MergeAndCleanup.java working tree sync. PATTERN-016 at 11 total/9 after-fix - highest after-fix recurrence of all patterns.
ESCALATE-A018.stronger_fix: Implement all three code fixes: (1) GitSquash.java deleteBackupBranch() before returning OK. (2) work-with-issue Step 7 bash gate blocking approval if commit count > 1. (3) MergeAndCleanup.java: git reset --hard HEAD after fastForwardMerge() to sync working tree.

observations: Protocol violations at 64% (9/14) - persistent structural compliance gap
All three ineffective action items (A001, A003, A018) require code-level structural enforcement - documentation alone insufficient
Effective items (A004, A006, A007) all use hook-level or structural enforcement - confirms the pattern
PATTERN-016 (squash corruption) most urgent: 9/11 recurrences after fix, three code fixes pending
PATTERN-018 (stakeholder review quality) at 8/4 - A021 implementation overdue
A024 (mandatory step labeling) high priority, open and unimplemented
A023 (line-length verification) low priority, open and unimplemented

retrospectives.summary: 25 mistakes across 6 categories. protocol_violation dominant at 68% (17/25). No new PATTERN-001 (subagent fabrication) recurrences — stabilization trend continues. No new PATTERN-016 (squash corruption) instances; M418 is a different sub-issue (git-rebase-safe false positive when base branch advances, issue created). ESCALATE-A001, ESCALATE-A003, ESCALATE-A018 all remain open. Open action items A021, A023, A024 still unimplemented.

escalation_updates.ESCALATE-A001: No new PATTERN-001 recurrences in this period. A012 (descriptive placeholders) may be stabilizing fabrication. Monitor next period; if clean, consider closing escalation.
escalation_updates.ESCALATE-A003: documentation_priming category (1 instance) may represent new path-assumption variant. Hook coverage still limited to Edit/Write tool calls. Core gap unresolved.
escalation_updates.ESCALATE-A018: M418 (git-rebase-safe VERIFY_FAILED false positive when base branch advances) is a new incorrect_implementation instance in the rebase-safe tool, not squash corruption. Issue 2.1-fix-git-rebase-safe-false-positive-when-base-branch-advances created. The three squash-specific sub-fixes (GitSquash.java backup cleanup, work-with-issue commit count gate, MergeAndCleanup.java working tree sync) remain unimplemented.

observations: protocol_violation at 68% (17/25) — persistent structural compliance gap
PATTERN-001 (subagent fabrication) shows no new recurrences — second clean period; A012 may be effective
PATTERN-016 (squash corruption) shows no new instances; M418 is a separate rebase-safe tool bug
M418 new issue: git-rebase-safe produces VERIFY_FAILED false positive when base branch advances between worktree creation and rebase. Patch-diff verification needed.
A021 (stakeholder review quality), A023 (line-length), A024 (mandatory step labeling) all open and unimplemented — highest implementation priority
A004/A006/A007 remain consistently effective across all retrospective periods
